definitions.definition: The act or process of recasting.
An utterance translated into another grammatical form.
definitions.example: Adults may use recasts to suggest corrections to mistakes in children's speech.
The whole bell had to be recast although it had only one tiny, hardly visible crack.

definitions.definition: To reproduce in a new form.
To assign (roles in a play or performance) to different actors.

definitions.example: She was recast as the villain.
